intro: Lomaria euphlebia var. serrata, commonly known as the serrated lomaria, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in sunny to partially shaded environments. The plant features slender, upright stems with lance-shaped leaves that have serrated edges, giving it its common name. Its small, bell-shaped flowers are usually pink or purple and bloom in late summer. It is valued for its ornamental appeal and is often cultivated in rock gardens or as a border plant.
